plot: Eugene Tooms, a supernatural killer whom Mulder helped incarcerate, is released on parole.

Mulder seems to be the only person concerned at the prospect that Eugene Tooms is about to be released from the psychiatric institution he's been in for several months. His pleadings fall on deaf ears as Tooms has never been convicted of a crime and the review board find Mulder's claims preposterous. Mulder is convinced Tooms will strike again and begins to follow him while Scully contacts the retired police detective, Frank Briggs, who had helped them in their earlier investigation. An old corpse from a long ago killing helps them out.—garykmcd

Eugene Victor Tooms has been pardoned for Mulder's accusations, mainly because of the lack of substantial human evidence. It is up to Mulder and Scully to stop him before he gets what he needs - one last victim before the thirty-year hibernation period he's due for.—EJS
